name: wordpress-block-editor-fse
description: Modern WordPress block development and Full Site Editing with theme.json, block themes, and custom blocks for WordPress 6.7+
learning_path: Full Site Editing architecture and capabilities
Block theme structure (HTML templates and template parts)
Custom post types with block editor support
Migration from classic to block themes
key_features: theme.json version 3 schema with CSS custom properties
Custom post type integration with block editor
Template locking and default block layouts
Classic to block theme migration guide
use_cases: Building new block themes from scratch
Creating custom Gutenberg blocks for specific business needs
Implementing centralized design systems with theme.json
Migrating classic themes to modern FSE architecture
Enabling visual customization for non-technical users
Developing custom post types with rich block editing
Creating reusable block patterns and template parts
anti_patterns: Mixing classic and block theme approaches
Overriding core block styles with !important CSS
Using client-side rendering for static content
Hardcoding color/font values instead of CSS variables
Not using theme.json for design tokens

steps: Create theme.json with centralized design system (colors, typography, spacing)
Build custom blocks using block.json metadata + render.php for server-side rendering
Use HTML templates (templates/index.html) for block theme architecture instead of PHP files
Register custom post types with 'show_in_rest' => true for block editor support
Use @wordpress/scripts for build tooling (npm run start for development, npm run build for production)
typical_workflow: Set up wp-env for local development
Create HTML templates and template parts
Build custom blocks with block.json + render.php
Use npm run start for hot reloading during development
Build for production with npm run build
